title: Retrospective Study of Human Rabies Exposure and Associated Risk Factors in North-West Ethiopia
content: Background: Rabies, a zoonotic disease caused by the lyssavirus genus, is widely distributed and a significant cause of human death in Africa and Asia. The study aimed to investigate human rabies exposure and associated risk factors in Northwest Ethiopia. Methods: The study encompassed four zones, seven districts, and four kebeles from each district. Result: A total of 642 households were interviewed. In the current study, rabies exposure was revealed 10.47%. Over 98% of respondents displayed a strong understanding of rabies, with 99.69% correctly identifying rabies as a zoonotic disease. But, 80% of the interviewees trusted traditional medicine could treat rabies. Only 21.93% of the victims were taken post-exposure to prophylaxis.
